definition: to be buried with or next to dead person (of deceased's partner, or of funerary objects)
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to bury (the dead)/to inter
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)

sentences.english: Oh, I am just a poor man to be buried with you.
sentences.chinese: 噢，我真是一個可憐的陪葬品。

sentences.english: He was just a poor worker, buried with a single pot.
sentences.chinese: 他只是一個貧窮的工人，陪葬的只有一隻破罐子。

sentences.english: Guri didn't perish with her master, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，古麗沒有爲她的主人陪葬。

sentences.english: What was buried with the deceased was entirely based upon their social / economic standing.
sentences.chinese: 死者的陪葬品完全取決於他們的社會和經濟地位。

sentences.english: Luckily I dodged in time otherwise I might be buried with you.
sentences.chinese: 幸虧我躲得及時，不然，非得做了你的陪葬。

sentences.english: Intense lovers can leave bodies in their wake when the embers of love begin to cool.
sentences.chinese: 當愛的餘火開始冷卻，喜歡激烈的人會拿身體來陪葬。

sentences.english: In the burial pits there also stand hundreds of horses.
sentences.chinese: 陪葬坑中還挺立着幾百匹戰馬。

sentences.english: The fresco has been found in most of the accompanied tombs.
sentences.chinese: 四是，壁畫墓在陪葬墓中佔據主導地位。

sentences.english: Thy unused beauty must be tombed with thee.
sentences.chinese: 那閒置美都只能隨你去陪葬。

definition: to bury sth along with the dead/sacrificial grave goods
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)
to bury (the dead)/to inter
an execution/to put sb to death
to bury
to execute the whole family and confiscate their property
to bury/to inter
skeleton of the dead
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to wipe out/to exterminate
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to pay with one's life
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
intact corpse/dead body with no parts missing
to kill/to murder
